com.github.harverst.roper.model

Interface CharacterComponent<S,P>


  • public interface CharacterComponent<S,P>
    Character components work analogously to score components. In order to avoid complication, the order in which character components are applied needs to be irrelevant to the resulting character. By and large, the means to avoid order dependency is by only adding components.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void composite(Character<S,P> character)
      Adds information that composes this piece of the character.
      void seperate(Character<S,P> character)
      Removes information that composes this piece of the character.

    • Method Detail

      • composite

        void composite(Character<S,P> character)
        Adds information that composes this piece of the character.
        Parameters:
        character - The character being composited.

      • seperate

        void seperate(Character<S,P> character)
        Removes information that composes this piece of the character.
        Parameters:
        character - The character this component is being seperated from.
